net.dean.jraw.models

Class JsonModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.models.JsonModel
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccountPreferences, AuthData, EmbeddedMedia, FlairTemplate, KarmaBreakdown.Summary, LiveUpdate.Embed, OEmbed, RedditObject

    public abstract class JsonModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides an abstract model for retrieving data from a JSON node, although not necessarily relating to the Reddit API.

    • Method Detail

      • data

        public java.lang.String data(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves a String value from the JSON node.
        Parameters:
        name - The key to look up in the JSON node.
        Returns:
        An String in the JSON node

      • data

        public <T> T data(java.lang.String name,
         java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Retrieves a value from the JSON node (provided in the constructor) of type T. When the class is Boolean, Double, Integer, Long, Float, or String, then it returns one of those objects using JsonNode.asX(). If the class is URI or URL, a new URL or URI (respectively) is returned. If class is Date, then the JsonNode's value is assumed to be long representing unix epoch seconds. The value is multiplied by 1000 since the value is assumed to be in seconds) and then passed to Date.Date(long). If the class is RenderStringPair, then the JSON field for the HTML is assumed to be the name with "_html" appended to the given name. If any other class is passed, then String is assumed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The desired return data type
        Parameters:
        name - The key to look up in the JSON node.
        type - The wanted return value. Supported values are any class representing a primitive data type, such as Integer or Boolean.
        Returns:
        An object of type T in the JSON node
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the class given was not one mentioned above

      • getDataNode

        public org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode getDataNode()
        This method gets the "data" JsonNode. In a normal request (let's say to /r/pics' "about" API link), the Reddit API returns some JSON data. An example would look like this: 
         {
     "kind": "t5",
     "data": {
         "submit_text_html": null,
         "user_is_banned": false,
         "id": "2qh0u",
         ...
     }
 }
        The "data" node contains all the properties essential to this model.
        Returns:
        The JsonNode to get data from

      • asString

        protected java.lang.String asString(java.lang.Object val)
        Convenience method to be used in toString() methods that returns the String literal "null" if the value is null. If the object's toString() method throws a NullPointerException, then the String literal "(NullPointerException) is returned. If no exceptions were thrown, then this method returns val.toString().
        Parameters:
        val - The object to evaluate
        Returns:
        A string representation of the object

      • getJsonProperties

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Method> getJsonProperties(java.lang.Class<? extends JsonModel> thingClass)
        Gets a list of fields that have the JsonInteraction annotation attached to them. This method also returns JsonInteraction-annotated methods in this class' superclasses, up until JsonModel. Mainly used for testing.
        Parameters:
        thingClass - The class to search in
        Returns:
        A list of fields that have the JsonInteraction annotation
